channel.title: Quick Question!
channel.description:
ok so i've made a jar client and it works and everthing else.
now i need to put it as a webclient.
i know how to do that, but i dont understand this format
i know this might be a stupid question, but do i have to upload the jar client into uppit or something? or what? [CODE]<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>Your Webclient</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="yourclientname" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML>[/CODE]
Sorry if i sound nooby :p

item.title: Quick Question!
item.dc:creator: @Jake2008 Jake2008
item.description:
@Jake2008 wrote:

you can put it in your webhost, make sure the archive = “path to jar file here”

you could also put it in dropbox, and the path would be the dropbox direct download link.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

it has to be uploaded to the site along with the other stuff. file share sites won’t work because you do not have a direct link to the download.

Read full topic
